ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a very in-depth knowledge of Orientalism and the complicated relationship between the 'occident' and the 'orient'. I also developed skills in being able to analyze, discuss, and otherwise engage in primary and secondary sources.
I developed a historical understanding of oriental discourse and how orientalist narratives have been coopted to serve political purposes.
I was unfamiliar about the dichotomy between the Orient and the Occident as well as corresponding literature on this area. I developed a deeper knowledge of this field during this class.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
This course does a very good job in introducing you to the ideas and problems with the ideas of Orientalism and colonialism. 

I found that a majority of the class however, was already familiar with these ideas, which made the beginning of the class and a few of the discussion difficult for me because I felt like I was missing some background information.

The strengths of the course was the large emphasis on personal examples which were also accompanied with trips to the gallery and the art exhibits. Moreover, there was a freedom to write your project on just about anything. 

The course could have been improved with slightly more engagement and structure.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to other students because the topics and professor are both very interesting and engaging.
Yes! This was one of the best courses I have taken at Yale. Any course with Professor Gandhi will be excellent, and she does an amazing job of selecting engaging readings and structuring the course.
I would recommend this class because it taught me to think in a different manner.
If you are looking to expand your knowledge on Edward Said's work and Orientalism, I would definitely recommend taking this course.
